brandIdentity.designSummary: This brand design features a minimalistic and modern aesthetic with a strong emphasis on clarity and spaciousness. The color palette is dominated by a deep navy blue as the primary color, complemented by white backgrounds and subtle lighter blue gradients in abstract shapes. Typography is clean, geometric sans-serif, balancing professionalism with approachability. The layout is modular and column-based, with generous whitespace and clear visual hierarchy. Rounded corners and soft edges on images and containers add a smooth, contemporary feel. Buttons are distinctly styled with solid and outlined navy blue variants, supporting clear call-to-actions. Overall, the design conveys a forward-thinking, reliable, and user-friendly technology or IT solutions brand identity.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Professional, trustworthy, innovative, and approachable with a modern and clean personality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color for main interactive elements such as primary buttons, icons, and key text to establish brand recognition and trust. The 'primaryForeground' color is reserved for text and icons placed on 'primary' backgrounds to ensure readability. The 'secondary' color, which is white, serves as the base background to maintain a clean and spacious feel, with 'secondaryForeground' used for text and icons on white backgrounds to maintain strong contrast. The 'gradientLightBlue' and 'gradientMediumBlue' custom colors are used in abstract background shapes and imagery to add depth and a futuristic touch without overwhelming the interface. The 'buttonOutline' color is used for secondary buttons and borders, providing subtle emphasis while maintaining a minimal look. This palette ensures accessibility and a cohesive visual experience across the website.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' color combination meets WCAG AA standards for text and icon contrast, ensuring readability. The 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' background also meets WCAG AA contrast ratios for body text and headings. The use of white as the 'secondary' background maximizes contrast and clarity. Gradient colors are used decoratively and do not contain critical text, maintaining accessibility compliance.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all major titles and section headers to establish hierarchy and clarity. Headings should be bold or semi-bold with ample spacing to maintain readability and visual balance with paragraph text. Pair headings with the paragraph font to create a harmonious typographic system. Use the 'primary' color for headings to emphasize importance and maintain brand consistency.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'secondary' background meet WCAG AA contrast requirements, ensuring clear legibility for users with visual impairments.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text, descriptions, and smaller informational text. Maintain consistent line height and letter spacing for optimal readability. Paragraph text should primarily use the 'secondaryForeground' color to ensure contrast against the 'secondary' background. Combine with headings to create a clear typographic hierarchy and a cohesive reading experience.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' background meets WCAG AA contrast standards for body copy, supporting accessibility.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section places the main headline and call-to-action in the lower third of the hero image area, aligned left with ample whitespace around. This placement draws the eye naturally from the top left, balancing the large abstract image on the right. The text uses the 'primary' color for contrast against the light gradient background, ensuring readability. The call-to-action button is positioned below the text, clearly visible and inviting interaction. This layout creates a calm, focused introduction to the brand.

components.containers: Containers have a clean white background with subtle rounded corners and consistent padding, creating distinct content blocks without heavy borders. This approach maintains a light and open feel while organizing content clearly. The use of white backgrounds supports the 'secondary' color role, ensuring content stands out.
components.images: Images are abstract, softly blurred, and use gradient blue tones with rounded corners that echo container shapes. This treatment integrates images seamlessly into the design, reinforcing the futuristic and tech-oriented brand identity without distraction.
components.buttons: Primary buttons use a solid 'primary' navy blue background with white text for strong call-to-action emphasis. Secondary buttons have a white background with a 'buttonOutline' navy border and text, providing a subtle alternative action style. Buttons have rounded corners consistent with container and image shapes, maintaining visual harmony.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal, line-based, and use the 'primary' navy blue color. They are simple and consistent, supporting clarity and user guidance without visual clutter.
graphicElements.illustrations: No traditional illustrations are used; instead, abstract gradient shapes and softly blurred images serve as visual interest elements, reinforcing the modern and innovative brand tone.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are present, maintaining the clean and minimal aesthetic.

brandIdentity.designSummary: This brand design embraces a modern, minimalistic aesthetic with a strong focus on clarity and user engagement. The layout is spacious and balanced, featuring generous white space and a clean white background that enhances readability and visual comfort. Typography is a key element, utilizing large, geometric sans-serif fonts for headings that convey professionalism and approachability, paired with clean, legible body text. The primary brand color is a vibrant purple used consistently for interactive elements such as buttons and highlighted text, providing energetic contrast against the neutral background. UI components like cards and buttons feature rounded corners and subtle shadows, adding softness and depth without cluttering the interface. The overall visual tone is tech-forward, innovative, and user-friendly, designed to communicate trust and ease of use across diverse digital platforms.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Professional, approachable, innovative, clear, and user-centric.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color predominantly for call-to-action buttons, interactive elements, and key highlights to draw user attention. The 'primaryForeground' color should be used for text and icons placed on 'primary' backgrounds to ensure readability. The 'background' color provides a clean, neutral canvas for the entire site, while 'secondary' and 'cardBackground' colors are used for UI containers and cards to create subtle separation and layering without harsh contrast. Text should primarily use 'textPrimary' for maximum legibility. Buttons and interactive elements should combine 'buttonBackground' with 'buttonForeground' for clear visibility and accessibility. Input fields and other form elements should use 'inputBackground' with subtle 'inputBorder' colors to maintain a clean and unobtrusive appearance. This palette ensures a harmonious balance between vibrancy and neutrality, supporting a modern and accessible user experience.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' background achieves WCAG AA and AAA contrast ratios, ensuring text on buttons is highly legible. The 'textPrimary' on 'background' also meets WCAG AAA standards for body text readability. 'SecondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds provides sufficient contrast for UI containers and cards. Overall, the palette supports strong accessibility compliance for text and interactive elements.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all primary titles and section headers to establish clear hierarchy and brand personality. Pair with the paragraph font for body text to maintain readability and visual harmony. Maintain ample spacing above and below headings to enhance legibility and separation. Use 'primary' color for emphasis or black for neutral headings depending on context. Avoid overly tight letter spacing to preserve clarity.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings using 'textPrimary' on 'background' or 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' backgrounds meet WCAG AA and AAA contrast standards, ensuring accessibility for users with visual impairments.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text, descriptions, and secondary information. Maintain consistent line height and letter spacing to enhance readability. Combine with heading fonts to create a balanced typographic hierarchy. Text color should primarily be 'textPrimary' on 'background' or 'secondary' containers. Avoid using paragraph fonts in all caps or overly bold weights to preserve legibility.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Body text using 'textPrimary' on 'background' or 'secondary' backgrounds meets WCAG AA and AAA contrast requirements for normal and large text sizes.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section places large, bold headings anchored in the top third of the viewport, aligned left with generous white space around. This placement draws immediate attention to the core message while leaving ample room below for supporting UI elements and calls to action. The heading uses the 'primary' color selectively to highlight key phrases, creating visual interest and guiding the user's eye. The call-to-action button is positioned near the heading with consistent spacing, using the 'primary' color background and 'primaryForeground' text for prominence. This typographic strategy balances impact with clarity, ensuring the welcome message is both inviting and easy to read.

components.containers: Containers use a light gray background ('cardBackground') with subtle drop shadows and rounded corners to create a soft, elevated effect. Padding inside containers is consistent to maintain content clarity and separation. Borders are minimal or absent, relying on shadows and spacing for definition.
components.images: Images and UI mockups are presented with rounded corners and subtle shadows to integrate smoothly with the overall soft UI style. They are balanced with text content to maintain visual harmony and avoid clutter.
components.buttons: Buttons are pill-shaped with solid 'primary' color backgrounds and 'primaryForeground' text. They have subtle hover states that slightly darken the background color for interactivity feedback. Secondary buttons use a transparent background with a 'primary' color border and text, maintaining consistency and accessibility.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal, monochrome, and use the 'textPrimary' color to maintain visual consistency and clarity. They are sized appropriately to complement text without overpowering it.
graphicElements.illustrations: Illustrations are minimal or abstract, using soft gradients and subtle overlays that do not compete with the UI elements. They support the tech-forward and innovative brand personality.
graphicElements.stickers: No prominent use of stickers or badges is observed; if used, they should be subtle and consistent with the 'primary' color palette.

brandIdentity.designSummary: The design features a modern dark mode aesthetic with a solid black background that creates a sleek and immersive environment. Vibrant neon green and bright blue accent colors energize the interface, highlighting interactive elements and branding. Typography is geometric, clean, and sans-serif, with large, bold headings that mix white and neon green to emphasize key messages. The layout is spacious and balanced, using a centered column grid with generous negative space and rounded corners on containers and buttons to soften the high-tech feel. The footer employs a modular grid with distinct colored blocks, maintaining visual consistency and clarity. Overall, the design conveys a cutting-edge, digital culture vibe suitable for a gaming or tech conference, combining high contrast, minimalism, and vibrant accents for a friendly yet professional look.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Futuristic, innovative, approachable, and tech-savvy with a casual yet professional personality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' black color as the main background to create a sleek, immersive environment. The 'primaryForeground' white color is ideal for main text and icons to ensure maximum readability and contrast. The 'secondary' blue color should be used for branding elements such as color blocks,UI cards, repeters logos and footer backgrounds, paired with 'secondaryForeground' white for text and icons. The 'accentNeonGreen' color is reserved for interactive elements like buttons, badges, and icons to draw user attention and convey energy and innovation. The 'accentPeach' color provides a subtle warm contrast in secondary UI elements such as social media icon backgrounds, balancing the cool palette. Combine these colors thoughtfully to maintain high contrast and accessibility, ensuring that text and interactive elements stand out clearly against backgrounds.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The combination of 'primaryForeground' white on 'primary' black background meets WCAG AAA contrast standards for text readability. The 'accentNeonGreen' on black also provides excellent contrast, suitable for buttons and badges. The 'secondaryForeground' white on 'secondary' blue background meets WCAG AA standards for text. The 'accentPeach' on blue background should be used for non-critical elements or icons to maintain sufficient contrast. Overall, the palette supports strong accessibility compliance for text and interactive elements.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font in large sizes with bold weight to create impactful titles and section headers. Mix white and 'accentNeonGreen' colors to highlight key words or phrases, enhancing visual hierarchy. Pair headings with paragraph fonts by maintaining clear spacing and contrast. Ensure headings remain legible on dark backgrounds by using 'primaryForeground' or 'accentNeonGreen' colors. Avoid overly condensed or decorative styles to preserve clarity.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primaryForeground' white or 'accentNeonGreen' on 'primary' black background meet WCAG AAA contrast standards, ensuring excellent readability for all users.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font in regular weight and moderate sizes for body text, descriptions, and navigation links. Maintain high contrast by using 'primaryForeground' white on 'primary' black or 'secondary' blue backgrounds. Ensure sufficient line height and letter spacing for comfortable reading. Pair paragraphs with bold headings to create clear content hierarchy. Avoid using accent colors for large blocks of text to maintain readability.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'primaryForeground' white on 'primary' black or 'secondary' blue backgrounds meets WCAG AA or higher contrast standards, supporting accessibility.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section uses a large, bold heading centered horizontally and vertically within the viewport. The heading text is split with a mix of 'primaryForeground' white and 'accentNeonGreen' colors to emphasize key words. Supporting text is placed below the heading in smaller white font, maintaining strong contrast. Interactive badges and date tags are positioned near the heading with rounded shapes and neon green backgrounds, reinforcing the futuristic theme. The overall typographic placement creates a strong focal point that immediately communicates the event's identity.

components.containers: Containers have rounded corners with solid backgrounds in black, neon green, blue, or peach depending on context. They maintain consistent padding and spacing, creating modular blocks that organize content clearly. The use of bright accent backgrounds for interactive or navigational containers draws user attention effectively.
components.images: Images are minimal or abstract, often replaced by graphic elements or logos. When present, images are framed within rounded containers or circular shapes to maintain design consistency.
components.buttons: Buttons are rounded with solid backgrounds in 'accentNeonGreen' or outlined in white. Text on buttons is white or black depending on background for maximum contrast. Buttons have clear hover states and are sized for easy interaction.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are simple, modern, and use the 'accentNeonGreen' color to stand out against dark backgrounds. They have rounded shapes consistent with the overall design language and are used sparingly to support navigation and calls to action.
graphicElements.illustrations: No prominent illustrations are used; the design relies on abstract shapes and logos to convey brand identity.
graphicElements.stickers: Badges and stickers use rounded pill shapes with 'accentNeonGreen' backgrounds and black text, providing clear, friendly labels for event types and dates.

brandIdentity.designSummary: This brand design embraces a minimalist and modern aesthetic characterized by spacious layouts, clean typography, and a restrained pastel color palette. The primary background colors are soft off-whites and pale blues, creating a calm and inviting canvas. Text and interactive elements predominantly use a deep navy blue, ensuring strong contrast and readability. Accent colors in subtle pastel purple and yellow appear in small UI elements, adding gentle vibrancy without overwhelming the design. Typography is geometric sans-serif, with large, bold headings paired with lighter, well-spaced body text to enhance clarity and hierarchy. The layout employs modular grids with generous negative space, balancing text and iconography in a harmonious, user-friendly manner. Buttons are solid, rounded rectangles with dark backgrounds and white text, emphasizing clear calls to action. Overall, the design conveys professionalism, approachability, and efficiency, making it highly adaptable for educational platforms, professional services, and technology brands seeking a clean and trustworthy online presence.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Professional, approachable, clear, and trustworthy with a calm and efficient personality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'background' color as the primary canvas for all pages to maintain a clean and calm atmosphere. The 'primary' color should be reserved for main text, headings, and key interactive elements such as buttons and links, paired with 'primaryForeground' for text on these elements to ensure readability. The 'secondary' color and its 'secondaryForeground' are ideal for subtle UI accents, secondary buttons, and category tags, providing gentle contrast without overpowering the primary content. Custom colors like 'softYellowAccent' and 'lightPurpleAccent' are best used sparingly for highlighting informational badges, icons, or subtle background gradients to add visual interest while preserving the minimalist tone. This palette ensures accessibility and visual harmony, supporting a professional and approachable brand presence.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primary' color (#1E254E) on 'background' (#F7F9FF) achieves excellent contrast exceeding WCAG AA standards for both normal and large text. Buttons using 'primary' with 'primaryForeground' (#FFFFFF) also meet AAA contrast requirements. The 'secondary' color (#A59FE6) on 'background' provides sufficient contrast for UI accents and secondary text, meeting WCAG AA for large text. Custom colors 'softYellowAccent' and 'lightPurpleAccent' are used in small UI elements and backgrounds where contrast requirements are less stringent but should be paired with 'primary' or 'primaryForeground' text to maintain readability and accessibility compliance.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all major titles and section headers to establish clear content hierarchy. Headings should be large and bold with ample spacing to enhance readability and visual impact. Pair headings with the paragraph font to create a balanced typographic rhythm. Ensure headings use the 'primary' color for maximum contrast against the 'background'. Maintain consistent letter spacing and line height to preserve clarity across devices and screen sizes.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'background' meet WCAG AAA contrast standards, ensuring excellent readability for all users.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body copy, descriptions, and supporting text. Maintain a lighter font weight and moderate size to ensure comfortable reading. Paragraph text should use the 'primary' color or a slightly lighter shade if needed for secondary information, always ensuring sufficient contrast with the 'background'. Combine with headings to create a clear typographic hierarchy and consistent user experience. Line height and letter spacing should be optimized for legibility on all screen sizes.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'primary' color on 'background' meets WCAG AA contrast requirements for normal text, supporting accessibility and readability.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section typography is anchored in the bottom third of the layout, creating a grounded and approachable introduction. Large, bold headings occupy the lower left quadrant, balanced by supporting text and call-to-action buttons placed nearby with ample negative space. This placement draws the eye naturally from the headline to the action, leveraging the spacious layout and clean typography to create a welcoming and clear entry point for users.

components.containers: Containers use subtle rounded corners and light backgrounds with gentle shadows or borders to separate content blocks. They maintain consistent padding and spacing to preserve the clean and spacious feel. Background colors often use 'background' or custom pastel accents to differentiate sections without overwhelming the user.
components.images: Images are used sparingly and are well-integrated with text content, often aligned to the right or left of text blocks. They maintain natural proportions and are framed with generous white space to avoid clutter. Image treatments are minimal, focusing on clarity and relevance.
components.buttons: Buttons are solid with rounded corners, primarily using the 'primary' color for backgrounds and 'primaryForeground' for text. Secondary buttons use lighter backgrounds with 'secondary' color text and borders. Buttons have clear hover states and sufficient padding for easy interaction.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimalistic, line-based, and use the 'primary' or 'secondary' colors depending on context. They are small, simple, and consistent in style, supporting content without distraction.
graphicElements.illustrations: Illustrations are minimal or absent in the UI, with the design favoring photographic or video content where applicable. When present, they use the custom pastel colors to maintain harmony.
graphicElements.stickers: Stickers or badges are small, color-coded UI elements using 'softYellowAccent' or 'lightPurpleAccent' to categorize or highlight content. They have rounded corners and subtle shadows to stand out gently.

brandBook.toneOfVoice: Professional, trustworthy, innovative, and approachable with a modern and clean personality.

Secondary buttons have a white background with a 'buttonOutline' navy border and text, providing a subtle alternative action style. Buttons have rounded corners consistent with container and image shapes, maintaining visual harmony.
components.containers: Containers have a clean white background with subtle rounded corners and consistent padding, creating distinct content blocks without heavy borders. This approach maintains a light and open feel while organizing content clearly. The use of white backgrounds supports the 'secondary' color role, ensuring content stands out.

Headings should be bold or semi-bold with ample spacing to maintain readability and visual balance with paragraph text. Pair headings with the paragraph font to create a harmonious typographic system. Use the 'primary' color for headings to emphasize importance and maintain brand consistency.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'secondary' background meet WCAG AA contrast requirements, ensuring clear legibility for users with visual impairments.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text, descriptions, and smaller informational text. Maintain consistent line height and letter spacing for optimal readability. Paragraph text should primarily use the 'secondaryForeground' color to ensure contrast against the 'secondary' background. Combine with headings to create a clear typographic hierarchy and a cohesive reading experience.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' background meets WCAG AA contrast standards for body copy, supporting accessibility.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section places the main headline and call-to-action in the lower third of the hero image area, aligned left with ample whitespace around. This placement draws the eye naturally from the top left, balancing the large abstract image on the right. The text uses the 'primary' color for contrast against the light gradient background, ensuring readability. The call-to-action button is positioned below the text, clearly visible and inviting interaction. This layout creates a calm, focused introduction to the brand.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal, line-based, and use the 'primary' navy blue color. They are simple and consistent, supporting clarity and user guidance without visual clutter.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are present, maintaining the clean and minimal aesthetic.
graphicElements.illustrations: No traditional illustrations are used; instead, abstract gradient shapes and softly blurred images serve as visual interest elements, reinforcing the modern and innovative brand tone.

initialPrompt: Smart Inventory & Sales Management System with AI Demand Forecasting for small and medium businesses. Features: user authentication with roles (admin, staff, manager), product and inventory management, real-time stock tracking, low-stock alerts, sales management (orders, invoices, payments), AI-based demand forecasting, analytics dashboard, reporting, and notifications. Responsive UI, secure, scalable, and fast. Tech stack: React.js, Tailwind CSS, Chart.js, Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, Python Flask (AI), JWT, Google OAuth, AWS deployment.
